'''Orlin''' was a [[Man]] of [[Hithlum|Hisilómë]] according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in [[The Book of Lost Tales|''The Book of Lost Tales'']]. 

He was akin to [[Túrin|Turambar]] himself through [[Morwen|Mavwin]]. When Turambar came to [[Brodda's hall]] and murdered [[Brodda|the lord]] in vengeance, Orlin was one of the few men present there who tried to seize Turambar, being the only one killed. When [[Airin]] appeared and the people waited for her judgement, she explained Turambar had indeed commited a grave crime killing someone akin to his mother and in a hall of feast, but that, as it was in his defence, he would only be condemned to exile.<ref>{{LT2|II}}, p. 90</ref>
